data.label:
Narrator

My shoes echoed on stone as I walked down the palace corridor to Hugo's study.

Hugo Toras

"Your Majesty. Thank you for joining me this evening."

Player_Romus

"'Certain members'. Are you one of them?"

Player_Romus

"My decisions were made with my country in mind. If that pisses off a few cousins, so be it."

Player_Romus

"What do you mean? I've done nothing but try to earn their favor since I took the throne."

Narrator

Bruno was trying to jump up into my uncle's lap. Hugo sternly shooed the dog off and ordered him to lie at his feet.

Player_Romus

"I'll thank you to be nicer to Bruno."

Player_Romus

"Surely they realize the extenuating circumstances I'm facing."

Player_Romus

"My decisions as king have been made with my country in mind. If my cousins like them too, that's just a bonus."

Player_Romus

"Thank you for telling me that. It means a lot to know I have Valenqiris' support during these trying times."

Hugo Toras

"'Extenuating circumstances' do not explain all of your policies."

Hugo Toras

"Your decision to bulldoze Valenqiris' most venerated vineyards to create a new gold mine made sense for our finances, but did harm the reputation of Qalus and its surroundings."

Hugo Toras

"There has been a sizeable backlash against the anti-landowner tax you introduced."

Hugo Toras

"Your permissive attitude towards foreigners has left native Rizians questioning their place in the new order."

Hugo Toras

"I beg your pardon, but you cannot be serious about that."

Hugo Toras

"Our relations are unfortunately more than merely 'pissed off''."

Hugo Toras

"I myself would never say a word against you. But some of your decisions have admittedly vexed me."

Hugo Toras

"Your attempts have paid off."

Player_Romus

"I'm not going to apologize for anything."

Hugo Toras

"Some of those 'crackpots' wield extraordinary influence in Valenqiris and Rizia Imperii."

Hugo Toras

"But you can make wiser ones in the future."

Hugo Toras

"To lose House Toras is to lose Valenqiris and Rizia Imperii. In other words, half of our kingdom's population."

Hugo Toras

"Manus Sazon."

Hugo Toras

"But I will tell you this. If you permit Her Highness to marry this man, your grip on the throne will weaken to the point where I cannot recover it."

Hugo Toras

"I am certain you had good intentions in allowing the Sazon heir to court Vina."

Player_Romus

"I've been good to his house. Perhaps I can convince him to back off."

Hugo Toras

"As a first step, yes."

Narrator

Hugo replied without a trace of anger in his voice.

Hugo Toras

"By all means, then, allow the Sazon union to proceed."

Player_Romus

"No. I could never do that to Vina."

Player_Romus

"What makes you think I'd even consider such a suggestion?"

Hugo Toras

"But if that doesn't work, you have other channels available to you."

Manus Talk

Manus Talk

Hugo Toras

"Once Vina makes it safely home from Pales, that is."

Hugo Toras

"He's an intelligent young man. Surely he can be persuaded to do right by this kingdom."

Manus Actions

Manus Actions

Hugo Toras

"But if you're going to allow Mr. Sazon to lurk in the background, it's even more imperative that Her Highness be wed as soon as possible."

Hugo Toras

"She's still young, you know."

Hugo Toras

"Apologies if I misunderstood, Your Majesty. I thought you expanded the Golden Guard with exactly this kind of eventuality in mind."

Hugo Toras

"I have not even mentioned our house's gravest concern."

Narrator

He spoke the name like a curse word.

Player_Romus

"Don't be ridiculous, Hugo. I wouldn't let Vina anywhere near him."

Hugo Toras

"Even more so now that you have jeopardized your relationship with House Toras."

Hugo Toras

"I will assume you did not grant it."

Player_Romus

"With a heavy heart, I denied their love."

Hugo Toras

"It was the right decision."

Hugo Toras

"He's an ambitious young man. There must be something he wants more than the Princess."

Hugo Toras

"In the long run, it is kinder to break her heart than to doom her reign."

Player_Romus

"Why do you think I sent her to Pales? It's been so long that she probably doesn't even think about him anymore."

Hugo Toras

"Think of Lyza the Great's single folly. Do not underestimate the allure of forbidden love."

Hugo Toras

"But if you're going to allow Mr. Sazon to lurk in the background, it's even more imperative that Her Highness be wed immediately after her return from Pales."

Player_Romus

"The last time you tried getting those two together, Bruno got shot."

Hugo Toras

"They'll forgive any number of transgressions if they know a Toras heir is forthcoming."

Narrator

He lowered his voice.

Player_Romus

"Sounds ghastly. But if there's no other way out of this..."

Player_Romus

"It means a lot to know you're on my side, even if the rest of our house is not."

Player_Romus

"I don't want you to 'spin' anything. Our relatives will accept this pairing even if I have to cram it down their throats."

Player_Romus

"I am confident that you will."

Player_Romus

"Thank you for trying anyway."

Narrator

He peered at me sternly.

Hugo Toras

"And the last thing you want to do is lose the popularity you've gained with House Toras."

Hugo Toras

"Forgive me. But as you know, whom the Princess weds affects us all."

Player_Romus

"Absolutely not. No king should be above the law."

Player_Romus

"Hugo. How could you be so cold?"

Hugo Toras

"I am here to serve, Your Majesty."

Hugo Toras

"On the contrary. A sovereign, by virtue of his absolute authority and divine right, is the source from which all laws flow, not subject to them."

Hugo Toras

"Of course. I was hesitant to bring up that option because I thought you were fond of him."

Player_Romus

"I'd rather go straight for the stick. King Romus bends over backwards for nobody."

Hugo Toras

"By all means, make him an offer."

Player_Romus

"I'll hazard a guess. You think the lucky groom should be Rico."

Player_Romus

"It'll also produce a child with hooves."

Hugo Toras

"That's a myth. Need I remind you that I myself was the product of an inter-house marriage?"

Player_Romus

"I have half a mind to marry her to Axel Reinhart."

Narrator

Hugo drew his breath in through his teeth.

Hugo Toras

"Of course, Your Majesty."

Hugo Toras

"We came dangerously close to war with Pales. I would not trust the Duke with your daughter just yet."

Player_Romus

"I trust him. He has treated her well the entire time she has been over there."

Hugo Toras

"He had Iza under control. Your withdrawal of the police unit you'd transferred there complicated the situation."

Hugo Toras

"I will always support you, my nephew. Do not doubt my loyalty."

Hugo Toras

"I recall my mother saying something similar. Almost verbatim, in fact."

Hugo Toras

"We shall see."

Hugo Toras

"It's what I am here for."

Narrator

Hugo laughed.

Hugo Toras

"I do not want to worry you. But at this point, pairing Vina and Rico may be the only way to prevent key members of our house from switching allegiances."

Narrator

He paused in thoughtful reflection.

Player_Romus

"Think about it. It's the ultimate gesture of Rizian-Palesian unification."

Player_Romus

"I made a promise to her. I'd be a bad father if I didn't keep it."

Player_Romus

"For the good of the country? Or for our own house's gain?"

Player_Romus

"Father did know better than I knew myself at the time."

Hugo Toras

"Fathers usually do."

Player_Romus

"You would have made a lousy king, anyway."

Player_Romus

"I know. I apologize. Thank you for your loyalty."

Hugo Toras

"Regarding the Sazon situation, I will leave it up to you. Perhaps a good talking-to would be just as effective."

Hugo Toras

"I shouldn't be harping on about this with the Princess facing such an uncertain fate. The war deserves your full attention."

Player_Romus

"Indeed it does. I should be going now."

Player_Romus

"No, thank you for bringing this up. You've given me a lot to think about."

Hugo Toras

"I am sorry to harp on about this with the Princess facing such an uncertain fate. The war deserves your full attention."

Player_Romus

"You're my Grand Vizier and my uncle. Your advice is always valuable to me."

Narrator

We rose from our chairs.

Narrator

Bruno sat up and licked Hugo's hand hopefully. My uncle gave the dog a single pat on the head.

Narrator

Titus shadowed me down the hall as I made my way back towards my quarters.

Player_Romus_Italic

I picked up the phone.

Player_Romus_Italic

After instructing Titus to wait outside, I entered the study and picked up the phone.

Player_Romus

"Come in for a second, Titus. I want to speak to you privately."

Narrator

I asked the palace operator to give me a private line to Manus Sazon. After a few rings, he answered.

Manus Sazon

"{RiziaDLCText.ManusToPlayer}. To what do I owe this pleasure?"

Player_Romus_Italic

We kept walking until we reached my quarters.

Player_Romus

"What would it take for you to go on a permanent vacation?"

Player_Romus

"The time has come for you to do your patriotic duty. I am sending you to lead your province's battalion in Pales."

Narrator

I asked the palace operator to give me a private line to Rico Toras. After a few rings, my cousin picked up.

Rico Toras

"Your Majesty. It's been a while."

Rico Toras

"Your Majesty. How is Bruno?"

Rico Toras

"Anyway. Is there something I can do for you?"

Rico Toras

"Is there something I can do for you?"

Narrator

The line was quiet for a moment.

Player_Romus

"I just had an uncomfortable talk with my uncle. My house is pressuring me to dispose of you."

Player_Romus

"If he doesn't make it back alive, Vina will never forgive me."

Player_Romus

"And if he comes back a war hero?"

Hugo Toras

"By then, ideally, the Princess will have been claimed by another suitor."

Player_Romus

"His Rizian charisma... his charizzma, if you will. Or should we just call it 'rizz'?"

Narrator

The line was quiet for a moment.

Manus Sazon

"Be that as it may..."

Manus Sazon

"I feel I can aid our cause much more capably in Porte Drazon than on the battlefield."

Player_Romus

"You claim to speak for the people. But how will it look if you let your province send commoners to die while refusing to go to war yourself?"

Player_Romus

"You are going to Pales, Mr. Sazon. That's a royal order."

Player_Romus

"All right. If you insist on betraying your country as your father did before you, you don't have to go."

Narrator

He let out a long exhale.

Manus Sazon

"And I will do everything I can to bring the Princess home safe and sound."

Manus Sazon

"I..."

Narrator

He let out a long exhale.

Manus Sazon

"And I will do everything I can to lead Rizia to victory."

Player_Romus

"Never. She'll die on that island."

Player_Romus

"There are people out there who want you killed. It's dangerous for you to stay in the country."

Manus Sazon

"We were just starting to build momentum after our election gains. Removing me as majority leader could set us back years."

Manus Sazon

"We must not overlook our country's internal welfare, even during times of war. Otherwise, what are our soldiers even fighting for?"

Manus Sazon

"Reforms are no less important during wartime. In fact, they're especially crucial."

Manus Sazon

"I..."

Player_Romus

"I changed my mind about you and Vina. I want the two of you as far away from each other as possible."

Manus Sazon

"I appreciate your concern for my safety."

Manus Sazon

"I'm sorry? You made your approval quite clear on the Rizania."

Player_Romus

"Read the writing on the wall, son. Rizia has no use for you anymore. You need to get out while you still can."

Manus Sazon

"You made your feelings about us quite clear on the Rizania. We would never disrespect your wishes."

Manus Sazon

"I can't do that. My duty is to my house, my party and my country."

Manus Sazon

"I can't do that. Not now that my party has finally gained a majority in the House of Delegates."

Player_Romus

"If you do, your combat fatigues await."

Player_Romus

"I don't want you failing my daughter, either."

Manus Sazon

"Your faith in me is appreciated."

Manus Sazon

"Understood."

Manus Sazon

"Yes, you made yourself quite clear about that."

Narrator

I put down the receiver and looked at the phone.

Player_Romus

"Angelica has more than served her sentence. Perhaps it's indeed time to bring her home."

Manus Sazon

"Thank you."

Manus Sazon

"Oh-- of course. We will speak upon my return, {RiziaDLCText.ManusToPlayer}."

Player_Romus

"You must have read the rumors about her and Axel Reinhart. Who knows what she got up to over there?"

Player_Romus

"I'll put it this way. If you agree to leave Rizia and break off all contact with Vina, I will make it worth your while."

Narrator

I heard a sharp intake of breath.

Narrator

I heard a sharp intake of breath.

Manus Sazon

"Well. There is one thing."

Manus Sazon

"Your Majesty, if you really think such patently untrue allegations can convince me to abandon Vina, I..."

Manus Sazon

"She is more than happy with the direction in which you've taken Rizia."

Player_Romus

"Never. She'll die on that island for what she did."

Hugo Toras

"We've done nothing but talk shop lately, haven't we? Perhaps once Rizia wins the war, Rita and I can have you over for a proper dinner."

Player_Romus

"Sure. But I doubt things will ever calm down."

Player_Romus

"Nonsense. Dinner will be on me."

Player_Romus

"I'd love that. If my schedule allows."

Player_Romus

"That depends. Has she stopped nagging you to retire?"

Player_Romus

"No, nothing. Just making sure you pick up the phone when your king calls you."

Narrator

Bruno turned around a few times, then splayed himself out on the carpet in front of me.

Rico Toras

"That depends. What kind of assistance do you need?"

Rico Toras

"They're already hard at work sowing chaos in Zille. What else would you ask?"

Player_Romus

"You know how you weren't involved in the Zille bombing? I want you to be 'uninvolved' in the disappearance of Manus Sazon."

Player_Romus

"I changed my mind. They're already doing enough."

Player_Romus

"Sorry, the idiot operator connected me to you accidentally."

Player_Romus

"House Toras has deemed you a threat. And I take my family's concerns seriously."

Manus Sazon

"And of course, I could never leave Her Highness."

Narrator

I heard a sharp intake of breath.

Manus Sazon

"This is the twentieth century, Your Majesty. If you really think I'd let familial infighting interfere with my political obligations, I..."

Manus Sazon

"And if you want to keep my house's favor, her return will be crucial."

Player_Romus

"If we agree on this, I don't just want you to leave. I want you to break Vina's heart."

Player_Romus

"And her own leanings? Is she as radical as you are?"

Player_Romus

"Your love for your mother is touching. How about this, then: you leave Rizia, and I'll leave her alive."

Narrator

There was a long silence.

Manus Sazon

"For a chance to bring my mother back home... I will."

Manus Sazon

"Everything I learned about politics, I learned from her. Take from that what you will."

Narrator

A long moment passed in silence.

Player_Romus

"So you love your mother more than my daughter."

Manus Sazon

"Not at all. I thought she was doomed to waste away on Caleqabiz."

Player_Romus

"It's a deal, then. You will leave Rizia, and Angelica Sazon will return."

Player_Romus

"Never mind any of this. Freeing your mother is too high a price to pay."

Manus Sazon

"If that's the way it must be. Just give me a few days to get my affairs in order."

Manus Sazon

"And figure out what to say to Vina."

Manus Sazon

"I thought that might be the case."

Manus Sazon

"Don't worry. I won't tell anyone else we had this conversation."

Manus Sazon

"Your Majesty, you wouldn't execute the matriarch of the Sazon family without reason."

Player_Romus

"Who said I don't have a reason? She could be orchestrating another uprising from exile."

Player_Romus

"I wouldn't. But we're at war. Bombs get dropped in all kinds of places. Like Caleqabiz."

Player_Romus

"Relax. I was joking."

Manus Sazon

"Then what do you want, Your Majesty? Just tell me."

Player_Romus

"I will go with your suggestion. You will leave Rizia, and Angelica Sazon will return."

Phone Calls

Phone Calls

Player_Romus

"Tell her you met someone else."

Player_Romus

"Don't tell her a damn thing. Just go."

Player_Romus

"You'll come up with something, I'm sure."

Player_Romus

"I will."

Player_Romus

"Say what you want. The press won't print it."

Player_Romus

"You had better not."

Player_Romus

"You'd better not, or I'll tell her what a mama's boy you are."

Player_Romus

"Screw this. I'm not giving in to my uncle. Stay in Rizia, and I'll find a way to bring Angelica Sazon home."

Player_Romus

"It hasn't been done. Don't thank me yet."

Player_Romus

"Your discretion is appreciated."

Player_Romus

"Don't tell Vina I tried to get rid of you, though."

Manus Sazon

"Oh."

Manus Sazon

"Should I be surprised? I was practically born with a target drawn on me."

Narrator

The line was quiet for a moment.

Player_Romus

"My daughter, Vina. What do you think of her?"

Rico Toras

"She possesses all the beauty and grace one would expect of a royal scion, especially one from House Toras."

Player_Romus

"So... you don't think she's exceptional?"

Rico Toras

"What? No, of course she is."

Player_Romus

"You just can't wait to get your hands on her, can you?"

Rico Toras

"Aha."

Player_Romus

"Can those treasonous plans include seducing the King's daughter?"

Player_Romus

"Try and make it painless."

Rico Toras

"They most certainly can."

Rico Toras

"I'm happy to help out a friend of the movement."

Rico Toras

"I should say so. They've had their work cut out for them lately."

Titus Gordion

"Certainly, Your Majesty."

Narrator

Titus, Bruno and I entered the study. I shut the door behind us.

Player_Romus

"Come on, Bruno. Time to go."

Narrator

Bruno followed me out of the study.

Rico Toras

"I already told you Su Omina wasn't responsible. You've literally had years to find evidence against them."

Rico Toras

"Was that all?"

Rico Toras

"Um."

Player_Romus

"A political union may be in the works. But I'm warning you, you are not to lay so much as a finger on Vina without her consent."

Player_Romus

"I have. I don't believe the future of our kingdom should hinge on a marriage between cousins."

Rico Toras

"Not a problem."

Player_Romus

"Hugo has nothing to do with it. The Lord has ordained that House Toras shall keep the throne for millennia to come."

Rico Toras

"I have... needs... that certain women in certain establishments in Iza and Porte Drazon are already well trained to fulfill."

Rico Toras

"Halaita. If it is said, so it will be."

Rico Toras

"No Sazon is going to uproot this family tree."

Player_Romus

"Yes, that was it."

Rico Toras

"Aside from the obligation to produce an heir, I expect the Princess and I would go about our lives much as we have been."

Rico Toras

"You have a lot of plans for the future of our kingdom, don't you? None of which seem to involve actual Rizians."

Rico Toras

"As long as Rizia still belongs to Rizians, we'll survive."

Rico Toras

"Great."

Player_Romus

"I'm happy you see it that way as well."

Player_Romus

"I did not ask for that much information."

Player_Romus

"Well, that's good to know. Thank you for your honesty."

Player_Romus

"Don't leave me hanging. What needs?"

Rico Toras

"I didn't want you to think I was lying."

Player_Romus

"We will grow straight and proud, until we reach the stars."

Player_Romus

"Rizia su omina. Rizia above all."

Player_Romus

"In the end, it's the Rizian bloodline that matters. Not any individual house."

Player_Romus

"That depends on your definition of 'actual Rizians'."

Player_Romus

"Do not talk back to your king. My policies are not to be disputed."

Rico Toras

"Not by me alone. But there are others who feel this way."

Rico Toras

"Now and always."

Rico Toras

"Precisely."

Rico Toras

"I -- we -- will hold you to it."

Narrator

There was a click as he hung up.

Narrator

He hung up.

Manus Sazon

"Goodnight, then."

Narrator

Titus cautiously entered the study and shut the door behind him.

Rico Toras

"Absolutely, Your Majesty."

Rico Toras

"After everything you've done for me and this country, I owe you immensely."

Rico Toras

"You're my blood kin and the monarch of this kingdom. I will serve you for as long as you hold the throne."

Player_Romus

"You'd better not forget that."

Player_Romus

"And you'd never do anything to cut that time short... right?"

Player_Romus

"Careful not to abuse your power. Being my cousin doesn't make you immune from the law."

Rico Toras

"Yes, I know."

Rico Toras

"No, no. Never."

Rico Toras

"Then accept my gratitude."

Rico Toras

"I won't."

Rico Toras

"Service to my family is its own reward."

Rico Toras

"Good night."

Rico Toras

"I am nothing if not honest."

Player_Romus

"I asked you to frame Rico ages ago. What the devil is going on?"

Titus Gordion

"Truly sorry, Your Majesty. We've been wrapped up in the war."

Titus Gordion

"Truly sorry, Your Majesty. It hasn't been easy to find a way into his palace."

Player_Romus

"They had damn well better. The clock is ticking."

Player_Romus

"Splendid. It's about time the kid learned a lesson."

Player_Romus

"It gives me no great pleasure to turn in my cousin. But for a reunited Rizia, it has to be done."

Player_Romus

"Remember how I asked you to plant evidence against my cousin? I changed my mind."

Titus Gordion

"But I have not yet given the orders."

Player_Romus

"Well, if you've gone to all the trouble of planning it... I say do it."

Titus Gordion

"He is your cousin. Perhaps it's best to keep him close."

Titus Gordion

"Truly sorry. Our time has been limited since the war started."

Titus Gordion

"Yes, I'm aware. The Golden Guard will not fail you."

Titus Gordion

"I have no doubt that jailing him will be for the greater good."

Titus Gordion

"Not every king would be so brave."

Narrator

He nodded.

Titus Gordion

"Should you choose to assign us a similar task in the future, we will get to it straight away."

Narrator

Titus blinked.

Player_Romus

"No. I need him arrested. Preferably tonight."

Titus Gordion

"I haven't forgotten about our other assignments. Rest assured we'll ferret out the truth soon."

Player_Romus

"I need him out of the picture. Completely. I don't care how you do it."

Player_Romus

"I need you to do to him what you're doing to Rico Toras. But faster."

Titus Gordion

"Truly sorry, Your Majesty. We've been wrapped up in the war."

Player_Romus

"Actually, never mind Manus. Keep your focus on Rico."

Player_Romus

"Do it, then. But don't bother framing Rico. The kid could still be of use to me."

Titus Gordion

"Noted. I'll tell my men to switch their focus to the Sazon heir."

Titus Gordion

"Noted. Expect results soon."

Titus Gordion

"I see."

Player_Romus

"Good thinking, Titus. What would I do without you?"

Rico Toras

"See you in Iza next month? I hear we're both invited to speak at the university's anniversary."

Player_Romus

"Yes, I'm looking forward to it. As long as the students don't give us any trouble."

Player_Romus

"Don't remind me. I hate these kinds of engagements."

Player_Romus

"I expect the city to be in tip-top shape for my arrival."

Rico Toras

"Oh, it will be. Believe me."

Rico Toras

"Really? I find the spotlight so invigorating. Like a hot bath."

Rico Toras

"That's not up to me, I'm afraid."

Player_Romus

"How are you?"

Titus Gordion

"I'm well, Your Majesty. I apologize that the investigation into your father's death is taking such a long time."

Titus Gordion

"I'm well, Your Majesty. I apologize that our investigation into the Wehlen bombing is taking such a long time."

Titus Gordion

"The war has been weighing on my mind, as I'm sure it has yours."

Titus Gordion

"The fate of Zille has been weighing on my mind, as I'm sure it has yours."

Player_Romus

"You have no idea."

Player_Romus

"Do not worry. The Lord will show us the way."

Player_Romus

"I've hardly been thinking about it at all."

Narrator

Titus flinched.

Titus Gordion

"I admire your faith."

Titus Gordion

"I understand. It's only one of many problems you must attend to."

Titus Gordion

"You bear an unimaginable amount of responsibility. I do not envy you."

Player_Romus

"Don't let it happen again."

Player_Romus

"No worries. It happens to the best of us."

Player_Romus

"No. I watched the fight. There's simply no way that blow was enough to make you collapse."

Narrator

He lowered his eyes.

Titus Gordion

"Yes, you're right."

Manus Sazon

"Tell Vina..."

Player_Romus

"You should be scared. If I don't act, we might both lose our heads."

Manus Sazon

"Your Majesty, I decided a long time ago that I would not live in fear. Whenever I die, that's my time."

Player_Romus

"This does not bode well for our reform plans. They'll be watching our every move."

Manus Sazon

"I understand. I will."

Manus Sazon

"But that time doesn't have to be right now."

Manus Sazon

"As it stands, House Sazon will not protect you should you fall out of favor with your own family."

Manus Sazon

"However, there is one thing you can do that will earn you their -- our -- undying loyalty."

Manus Sazon

"Still, if you want to be sure of their -- our -- loyalty, there is one thing you have yet to do."

Player_Romus

"Never. She'll die on that island for what she did."

Player_Romus

"She has more than served her sentence. Perhaps it's indeed time to bring her home."

Manus Sazon

"What *did* she do? It's never been proven she had a hand in my father's crimes."

Manus Sazon

"It's been almost 30 years. Half her life."

Manus Sazon

"Is that such a bad thing?"

Player_Romus

"A canny suggestion. House Sazon will be considerably stronger with its matriarch back on the mainland."

Player_Romus

"No promises. But I'll see what I can do."

Player_Romus
